intro: Antriba budleoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is typically grown as a houseplant due to its preference for warm, humid conditions. Antriba budleoides is popular for its ornamental value and ease of care when provided with proper light and watering.
